channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Reclusive billionaire heir Timothy Melon gave $125 million to help elect Trump, even more than Elon Musk donated
item.description: A grandson of industrialist baron Andrew Mellon, he once railed against federal entitlements, which he said make Black people “belligerent.”

item.title: Dutch Police Hold 4 People Over Antisemitic Attacks on Soccer Fans
item.description: Physical and verbal violence erupted around a soccer match between an Israeli team and a Dutch team in Amsterdam on Thursday.

item.title: Is a ‘Green’ Revolution Poisoning India’s Capital?
item.description: An effort to turn India’s trash mountains into energy has become an acute health crisis for a million people in the capital city, New Delhi. Maria Abi...

item.title: Trump’s first year as President initially looked like a home run for business. Then things got complicated
item.description: Trump’s first year looked like a home run for business. It stopped cold in early 2018 when he launched a trade war against China, Mexico, Canada, and ...

item.title: Endocrine-disrupting chemicals are everywhere. Here’s how to reduce your exposure
item.description: Here's what experts suggest avoiding, from nonstick frying pans to certain beauty products.

item.title: Democrats and the Case of Mistaken Identity Politics
item.description: The post mortem is a wake for woke.

item.title: Train Station Suicide Bombing Leaves Dozens Dead or Wounded in Pakistan
item.description: A banned ethnic separatist group in a restive province claimed responsibility for the deadly attack in Quetta, the provincial capital.

item.title: U.N.-Backed Panel Warns Action Needed in ‘Days, Not Weeks’ to Avert Imminent Gaza Famine
item.description: The Biden administration has set a mid-November deadline for Israel to deliver more humanitarian supplies to the enclave or face a cutoff of weapons a...

item.title: Playing Favorites
item.description: The foods and music and culture that move us most might not be very good, but that doesn’t diminish their power to comfort and delight.

item.title: Millions were devastated by the election results, and so were their therapists. Here’s how they pushed through together
item.description: Bookings for mental-health sessions spiked on Wednesday, leaving bereft therapists to put their own reactions aside.

item.title: The Elites Had It Coming
item.description: Democrats got exactly what they set out to get, and now here we are.

item.title: Mike Johnson May Win the House but Lose His Dignity
item.description: He may be about to star in a new role as Trump’s legislative puppet.

item.title: U.N.-Backed Panel Warns Action Needed in ‘Days, Not Weeks’ to Avert Imminent Gaza Famine
item.description: The Biden administration has set a mid-November deadline for Israel to deliver more humanitarian supplies to the enclave or face a cutoff of weapons a...

item.title: This Is All Joe Biden’s Fault
item.description: Biden too often could not find the best way to help Democrats win.

item.title: 2 steps to wire your kids for resilience, according to parenting expert Dr. Becky
item.description: The single best gift you could ever give your kid, says the psychologist, "is the ability to handle hard things.”
